intro: Spermacoce ovalis, commonly known as the oval spurred morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive spurred petals and trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often hairy, while its stems are twining and can climb other vegetation. Spermacoce ovalis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
